page.title: 01ABBOTS BROMLEY GENERAL
page.content: {Abbots Bromley}is a village famous for the Horn Dance and has about two thousand people in it .The village was probably here before the Normans and was probably just a few huts when it started .The Horn Dance is held once a year and the Horn dancers dance with the horns on there head from 8.00 a.m to 9.00 p.m .All the land round Abbots Bromley is used for farming .Abbots Bromley is one of the oldest villages in this area .Abbots Bromley is a medium size village there used to be a market and under the butter cross was a butter stall.The village has five pubs.The Bagot Arms,The Royal Oak,The Goats Head ,The Crown and The Coach and Horses.
